string.name: wp_apple_handoff_short_name
string.context: The proper noun for Apple's Handoff technology. This is found at https://developer.apple.com/handoff/. This string is passed into other mychart strings that use this word in the sentence.

string.context: The proper noun for Apple's Handoff technology, prefixed by the name of the company (Apple). The handof is found at https://developer.apple.com/handoff/. This string is passed into other mychart strings that use this word in the sentence.

string.name: wp_handoff_wrong_org_title_ios

string.name: wp_future_appointment_hello_patient_disabled_details_message
string.context: Label on the appointment details page that explains that when the patient arrives at the appointment, their phone's location can automatically alert front desk staff of their arrival (but that this feature is currently not enabled).

string.name: wp_future_appointment_hello_patient_disabled_bluetooth_details_message
string.context: Label on the appointment details page that explains that when the patient arrives at the appointment, their phone's location and Bluetooth can automatically alert front desk staff of their arrival (but that this feature is currently not enabled).

resources.string: يمكن لموقع هاتفك، مع Bluetooth، إبلاغ موظفي مكتب الاستقبال عند وصولك. اضغط على الأيقونة لتمكين هذه الميزة.

string.name: wp_future_appointment_cancel_video_init_alert_title
string.context: Title of the alert displayed when the user tries to cancel the sign in process for a video visit.

string.name: wp_future_appointment_cancel_video_init_leave_action_title
string.context: The yes button for canceling the video visit.

string.name: wp_future_appointment_cancel_video_init_stay_action_title
string.context: The no button for canceling the video visit.

string.name: wp_appointment_payment_title_with_visit_title
string.context: The title of the a row in the future appointment details page that indicates that a particular appointment has a payment associated with it. %1$@ is the name/title of the appointment with the payment associated.

string.name: wp_appointment_copay_title_with_visit_title
string.context: The title of the a row in the future appointment details page that indicates that a particular appointment has a copay associated with it. %1$@ is the name/title of the appointment with the copay associated.

string.name: wp_appointment_prepay_title_with_visit_title
string.context: The title of the a row in the future appointment details page that indicates that a particular appointment has a prepay associated with it. %1$@ is the name/title of the appointment with the prepay associated.

string.name: wp_appointment_echeckin_composite_number_completed_title
string.context: A string telling the user how many appointments they have completed echeckin for. This happens for appointment panels which are comprised multiple appointments - like child appointments. This is telling the user how many of those child appointments they have completed echeckin for. %1$@ is the echeckin name (i.e. eCheck-in - however this can be customized by customers). %2$@ is the number of appointment the user has completed echeckin for. %3$@ is the total number of child appointments that have echeckin available.

resources.string: لقد أكملت %1$@ لـ %2$@ من %3$@ أجزاء من هذه الزيارة.

string.name: wp_appointment_payment_name
string.context: The word for Payments which is the word for how much the patient will need to pay for their upcoming appointment.

string.name: wp_composite_appointment_total_payment_due
string.context: String telling the user how much the total payment is for the appointment. In this scenario, the appointment is a panel meaning it is comprised of multiple child appointments. Each child appointment could have its own payment, so this string is showing what the combined/total payment is for the entire panel. %1$@ is the payment amount in dollars (i.e. $30.50)

string.name: wp_composite_appointment_total_payment_paid
string.context: String tell the user how much of the total payment for the appointment that they have already paid. In this scenario, the appointment is a panel meaning it is comprised of multiple child appointments. Each child appointment could have its own payment, so this string is showing what the combined/total amount they have paid for the entire panel. %1$@ is the amount they have already paid (i.e. $30.50)

string.name: wp_future_appointment_not_confirmed_detail_message
string.context: details of prep item for confirming an appointment

resources.string: تأكد الآن لتخطي مكالمة التذكير لهذا الموعد.

string.context: details of prep item for confirming multiple appointments

resources.string: تأكد الآن لتخطي مكالمة التذكير لهذه المواعيد.

plurals.name: wp_appointment_duration_minutes_hours
plurals.context: String telling the user how long their upcoming appointment will be. %1$@ is the number of hours. %2$@ is the number of minutes.

plurals.name: wp_appointment_duration_hours
plurals.context: String telling the user how long their upcoming appointment will be. %1$@ is the number of hours.

string.name: wp_appointment_duration_minutes
string.context: String telling a user how long their appointment will be. %1$@ is the number of minutes.

string.name: wp_appointment_cancellation_linked_appointments_table_header
string.context: Header for the list of linked appointments that will be cancelled by cancelling the selected appointments.

resources.string: يرتبط الموعد الذي تقوم بإلغاؤه بالمواعيد التالية التي سيتم إلغاؤها أيضاً.

string.name: wp_appointment_cancellation_comments_prompt_text
string.context: Placeholder text that hints the user to add comments while canceling an appointment.

string.name: wp_past_appointment_avs_button_text
string.context: Button text for the link to the AVS / past appointment details. The trademark ® logo should not be translated. It should only be included in the en-US version of this string.

string.name: wp_past_appointment_notes_button_text
string.context: Button text for the link to the notes for a past appointment.

string.name: wp_appointment_discharged_date_string
string.context: The string that shows the discharged date for the patient's past admission to the hospital. %1$@ is the date string the patient was discharged from the hospital. The date strings will be formatted like 'March 7, 2019'

string.name: wp_appointment_admission_date_string
string.contoext: The string that shows the date a patient was admitted to the hospital. %1$@ is the date string the patient was admitted on. The date strings will be formatted like 'March 7, 2019'

string.name: wp_past_appointment_avs_button_text_non_epic
string.context: Button text for the link to the past appointment details for a non-epic (H2G++) past appointment

string.name: wp_appointment_panel_visit_title_two_component_appointments
string.context: The title displayed for a panel of appointments when the panel appointment itself does not have a display name. Instead, we construct the visit title name using the visit titles of the first two child visits in the panel. %1$@ is the visit title of the first child visit. %2$@ is the visit title of the second child visit.

string.name: wp_appointment_panel_visit_title_more_than_two_component_appointments
string.context: The title displayed for a panel of appointments when the panel appointment itself does not have a display name. Instead, we construct the visit title name using the visit title of the first child visit and then displaying how many other child visits there are. %1$@ is the visit title of the first child visit. %2$@ is the number of the remaining visits in the panel appointment.

plurals.name: wp_appointment_direct_scheduled_success_message
plurals.context: String telling the user that they have successfully scheduled one or more appointments.

plurals.name: wp_appointment_request_scheduled_success_message
plurals.context: String telling the user that they have successfully requested to schedule one or more appointments.

تم استلام طلب المواعيد الخاصة بك.

plurals.name: wp_appointment_cancel_appointment_button_title
plurals.context: text for a button that a user can press to cancel an upcoming appointment.

string.name: wp_linked_appointment_cancellation_related_prompt
string.context: Title of a row in a table that tells the user which appointments that they are about to cancel. This string will be followed by another string saying something like '3 related appointments'

string.name: wp_linked_appointment_cancellation_related_text
string.context: Row in a table that is telling the user that they are cancelling mutliple related appointments. This string will be preceded by a prompt that says something like 'Cancel'. %1$@ is the number of related appointments that the user will be cancelling.

string.name: wp_ed_visit_expected_time
string.context: Displayed in appointment details activity in lieu of an actual time for Emergency Department visits, because the arrival time for ED visits is more fluid than other appointments

string.name: wp_ed_visit_expected_date
string.context: Date when the patient is expected at the emergency department, where %1$@ is the date. In English, the date will be of the form Saturday, April 24

string.name: wp_future_visit_change_visit_button_title_cancel
string.context: Title for button to cancel the visit.

string.name: wp_visit_cancel_phone_alert_title
string.context: Alert title telling the user that a phone call is required to cancel the selected visit.

string.name: wp_visit_cancel_phone_alert_message
string.context: Alert tells user that a call is required to cancel this visit. %1$@ is the number to call.

resources.string: يرجى الاتصال بـ%1$@ لإلغاء هذه الزيارة.

string.name: wp_visit_error_cancel_alert_message
string.context: Alert tells the user that the selected visit cannot be cancelled.

string.name: wp_visit_cancelled_direct_popup_message
string.context: Message displayed to the user to inform them they have successfully canceled a visit.

string.name: wp_visit_cancel_fail_title
string.context: Title of alert sent to user when we are unable to retrieve the details on how to cancel a visit.

string.name: wp_visit_cancel_fail_explanation
string.context: Message displayed to user when we are unable to retrieve the cancel details of a visit and thus cannot cancel the visit. %1$@ is the phone number to call.

resources.string: لا يمكن إلغاء الزيارة حالياً. لطفاً حاول لاحقاً أو اتصل بـ %1$@ لإلغاء هذه الزيارة.

string.name: wp_visit_cancel_fail_generic
string.context: Alert appears when a visit cancellation fails for an unknown reason

resources.string: لا يمكن إلغاء الزيارة حالياً. لطفاً حاول لاحقاً.

string.name: wp_visit_cancel_button_caption
string.context: Caption for button allowing user to cancel an upcoming visit.

string.name: wp_cancelvisit_attempt_failure_message
string.context: Appears when the user attempts to cancel a visit and the request fails.

string.name: wp_cancelappt_commentmaxlengthwarning
string.context: Appears when the user is exceeding the maximum allowed comment length. %1$@ is the maximum number of allowed characters in a comment

resources.string: لا يمكن أن تتجاوز الملاحظات %1$@ حرفاً.

string.name: wp_appointment_cancel_request_subject
string.context: Do not translate if your language cannot be represented with the Western European Latin script (windows-1252 code page). Default subject for an appointment cancellation request message. Can be seen in mobile Message Outbox and in Hyperspace inBasket

string.name: wp_appointment_offer_expire_today
string.context: The label informing the user when the appointment offer will expire if it expires today. %1$@ is the time the appointment expires(format: En-Us 8:26 AM). The characters '^' should be around the text for Today in order to highlight it red when displayed. They will be stripped after locating the today text.

string.name: wp_appointment_offer_expire_tomorrow
string.context: The label informing the user when the appointment offer will expire if it expires tomorrow. %1$@ is the time the appointment expires(format: En-Us 8:26 AM). The characters '^' should be around the text for Tomorrow in order to highlight it red when displayed. They will be stripped after locating the tomorrow text.

string.name: wp_appointment_offer_expire
string.context: The label informing the user when the appointment offer will expire. %1$@ is the date (localized day of week, mm/dd/yy) and %2$@ is the time the appointment expires(format: En-Us 8:26 AM).

string.name: wp_appointment_standalone_fast_pass_offer_prompt
string.context: Label text that informs the user that they can accept a wait list offer for an appointment they don't have an appointment for already

resources.string: يمكنك أن تأخذ وقت موعد متاح لموعدك المدرج في قائمة الانتظار.

string.name: wp_appointment_linked_fast_pass_offer_prompt
string.context: Message on top of the waitlist selection in the appointments view. Lets the user know that they hacve the option to select an earlier appoinment time

resources.string: يمكنك قبول وقت سابق لهذا الموعد.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_next_step_extra_steps_title
string.context: The appointment arrival alert title after user confirms their arrival, but they still have steps to complete

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_next_step_echeckin_message
string.context: The appointment arrival alert message for a sign in with available echeckin. %1$@ is the eCheckin custom name

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_onboarding_announcement
string.context: Accessibility Message, read by screen reader, alerting the user to the appearance of full-screen onboarding , to introduce the user to the appointment arrival feature.

resources.string: تنبيه، يبدو أن الإعداد قدّمك إلى خاصية وصول الموعد.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_onboarding_activity_title
string.context: Title of onboarding activity for the Appointment Arrival feature, where the user is introduced to the feature and asked if they want to enable it.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_onboarding_activity_explanation
string.context: Text displayed in the onboarding activity for Appointment Arrival feature, explaining what the feature does. %1$@ is the branded display name of the app.

resources.string: يمكن لـ%1$@ استخدام موقع هاتفك لإبلاغ موظفي العيادة عند وصولك لموعدك. ما عليك سوى تسجيل الوصول من هاتفك باستخدام ميزة موعد الوصول وهناك سوف تحصل على تعليمات عن ما يجب عليك فعله.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_begin_button
string.context: Title for the button to begin the process of turning on the Appointment Arrival feature.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_enable_button
string.context: Title for the button to turn on the Appointment Arrival feature.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_decline_button
string.context: Title for the button to opt-out of turning on the Appointment Arrival feature.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_decline_reminder
string.context: Reminder that displays to the user, after opting-out, that they can enable Appointment Arrival later via Account Settings. Only displays in a Toast for 3.5 seconds, so translations should be equally succinct.

resources.string: قم بزيارة إعدادات الحساب لتمكين خاصية وصول الموعد.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_accessibility_enable_button_location_missing
string.context: Accessibility Message, read by screen reader, appended to the Turn On Appointment Arrival button caption, explaining it is not enabled yet because the user has not granted Location permission.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_accessibility_enable_button_bluetooth_missing
string.context: Accessibility Message, read by screen reader, appended to the Turn On Appointment Arrival button caption, explaining it is not enabled yet because the user has not turned on Bluetooth. Bluetooth is a trademark and should not be translated.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_accessibility_enable_button_location_bluetooth_missing
string.context: Accessibility Message, read by screen reader, appended to the Turn On Appointment Arrival button caption, explaining it is not enabled yet because the user has not granted Location permission or turned on Bluetooth. Bluetooth is a trademark and should not be translated.

resources.string: تمكين عن طريق تشغيل الموقع و Bluetooth.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_title
string.context: Title of permissions activity for the Appointment Arrival feature, where the user will be asked to grant certain permissions before Appointment Arrival can be enabled.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_instructions
string.context: Instructions at the top of the screen where the user will be asked to grant certain permissions before Appointment Arrival can be enabled.

resources.string: لتمكين خاصية وصول الموعد, نطلب ما يلي:

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_bluetooth_title
string.context: Name of the Bluetooth feature on the device. This should not be translated into other languages - it is a trademark across all languages. In addition, the Registered Trademark symbol should be retained.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_bluetooth_title_accessibility
string.context: Name of the Bluetooth feature on the device, used specifically for accessibility so the Registered Trademark symbol is not read by screen readers. This should not be translated into other languages - it is a trademark across all languages.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_location_title_ios
string.context: Title for the card that explains the Location permission requirements for Appointment Arrival on iOS. This string should exactly match the name of the Location feature/concept that is listed in the Settings app on iOS across all languages.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_location_title_android
string.context: Title for the card that explains the Location permission requirements for Appointment Arrival on Android. This string should exactly match the name of the Location feature/concept that is listed in the Settings app on Android across all languages.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_location_instructions_ios
string.context: Label on the card that explains the location permission requirements for Appointment Arrival on iOS. %1$@ is the language-specific name of the Always permission.

resources.string: تأكد من السماح لـ \"%1$@\" باستخدام الموقع الجغرافي في إعدادات جهازك.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_location_instructions_ios_precise
string.context: Label on the card that explains the location permission requirements for Appointment Arrival on iOS 14+. %1$@ is the language-specific name of the Always permission.

resources.string: تأكد من السماح لـ \"%1$@\" باستخدام تحديد الموقع والموقع الدقيق في إعدادات جهازك.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_bluetooth_instructions_ios
string.context: Label on the card that explains the Bluetooth permission requirements for Appointment Arrival on iOS. 'Bluetooth' should not be translated into other languages - it is a trademark across all languages.

resources.string: تأكد من تمكين Bluetooth في إعدادات جهازك.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_location_while_using_warning_ios
string.context: Text for a warning that appears if the user has only enabled 'While Using' location permission for Appointment Arrival on iOS. %1$@ is the language-specific name of the While Using permission.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_location_warning_android
string.context: Text for a warning that appears if the user has only enabled 'While Using' location permission for Appointment Arrival on Android. %1$@ is the language-specific name of the While Using permission.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_location_while_using_warning_ios_precise
string.context: Text for a warning that appears if the user has only enabled 'While Using' location permission for Appointment Arrival on iOS 14+. %1$@ is the language-specific name of the While Using permission.

resources.string: لقد منحت \"%1$@\" الإذن فقط ولم تمنح تحديد الموقع الدقيق

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_permissions_activity_location_permission_denied_warning_ios

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_correct_time_dwell_message_long
string.context: The appointment arrival message shown when a user starts the appointment arrival workflow. %1$@ is the display time of the appointment. The display time is in the hh:mm aa format. Ex. 10:35 AM

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_correct_time_dwell_message_long_no_time
string.context: The appointment arrival message shown when a user starts the appointment arrival workflow. Used if the appointment date is invalid

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_alert_yes
string.context: The confirmation button for the appointment arrival workflow. This confirms the user is at the appointment and is ready to be check-in

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_correct_time_dwell_message_long_other
string.context: The appointment arrival message shown when a user starts the appointment arrival workflow for a subject. %1$@ is the subject, %2$@ is the appointment display time. The display time is in the hh:mm aa format. Ex. 10:35 AM

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_correct_time_dwell_message_long_other_no_time
string.context: The appointment arrival message shown when a user starts the appointment arrival workflow for a subject. Used if the appointment date is invalid. %1$@ is the subject.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_alert_subject_yes
string.context: The confirmation button for the appointment arrival alert for proxies. This confirms the patient is at the appointment and is ready to be check-in. %1$@ is the subject.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_alert_no
string.context: The decline button for the appointment arrival alert. This will snooze the arrival and ask the use again if they are ready in a few minutes (currently configured to 2 but could change in the future).

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_notification_title
string.context: The appointment arrival notification title. Showed as a title with more details below.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_nextstep_title
string.context: The appointment arrival title after user has confirmed their arrival. This has more details below it

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_echeckin_yes
string.context: The appointment arrival message after user has confirmed their arrival. This is for an appointment that requires eCheckin to be completed. %1$@ is the eCheckin custom name

string.name: wp_appointments_acc_appointment_cell_summary
string.context: The voiceover text for an appointment cell. %1$@ is the visit type of the appointment, %2$@ is the provider, %3$@ is the date of the appointment. ex. 'Office Visit with House M.D. on Thursday, Jan 13 2015.'

string.name: wp_appointments_acc_appointment_cell_summary_brief
string.context: The voiceover text for an appointment cell. %1$@ is the visit type and %2$@ is the date of the appointment. ex. 'Office Visit on Thursday, Jan 13 2015.'

string.name: wp_appointments_acc_appointment_cell_summary_department
string.context: The voiceover text for an appointment cell. %1$@ is the visit type of the appointment, %2$@ is the department of the visit, %3$@ is the date of the appointment. ex. 'Office Visit at Cedar Oaks Emergency Department on Thursday, Jan 13 2015.'

string.name: wp_appointments_acc_appointment_cell_summary_provider_and_department
string.context: The voiceover text for an appointment cell. %1$@ is the visit type of the appointment, %2$@ is the provider, %3$@ is the department of the visit, %4$@ is the date of the appointment. ex. 'Office Visit with House M.D. at Cedar Oaks Internal Medicine on Thursday, Jan 13 2015.'

string.name: wp_appointments_acc_unread_appointment_cell_summary
string.context: Voiceover text for the unviewed past encounter cells in Past encounter list. %1$@ is the viewed version of the accessibility label.

string.name: wp_appointments_acc_appointment_cell_summary_video_ready
string.context: The voiceover text for an appointment cell that is a video visit that is ready for the user to join. %1$@ is the visit type of the appointment, %2$@ is the provider, %3$@ is the date of the appointment. ex. 'Office Visit with House M.D. on Thursday, Jan 13 2015. Ready to begin video visit.'

string.name: wp_appointment_acc_appointment_cell_summary_barcode_ready
string.context: The voiceover text for an appointment cell that is echecked in with a barcode. %1$@ is the visit type of the appointment, %2$@ is the provider, %3$@ is the date of the appointment, %4$@ is the custom string for 'eCheck-in'. ex. 'Office Visit with House M.D. on Thursday, Jan 13 2015. Barcode available for eCheck-in.'

string.name: wp_appointment_acc_call_button_string
string.context: Accessibility string telling the user to make a phone call to the given phone number. This particular string is used in the appointments page where the phone number will be the number for the provider or department. %1$@ is the phone number of the provider or department.

string.name: wp_appointment_acc_map_button_string
string.context: Accessibility string for the map button on the future appointment details page. The string will tell the user what the address is for the appointment. Then, it will prompt them to open up the address on a map. %1$@ is the address of the appointment - like 1234 Epic Lane, Madison, WI 56372

string.name: wp_permissions_location_iOS_always
string.context: The name of the iOS location permission that allows access to location at all times. It should exactly match the name of the associated permission in the Settings app on iOS, across all languages. This string will be inserted into other strings, generally in quotes, to form strings such as 'The Appointment Arrival feature requires 'Always' location permissions.'

string.name: wp_permissions_location_iOS_while_using
string.context: The name of the iOS location permission that allows access to location while the app is in use. It should exactly match the name of the associated permission in the Settings app on iOS, across all languages. This string will be inserted into other strings, generally in quotes, to form strings such as 'This feature requires 'While Using' location permissions.'

string.name: wp_permissions_location_Android_while_using
string.context: The name of the iOS location permission that allows access to location while the app is in use. It should exactly match the name of the associated permission in the Settings app on Android, across all languages. This string will be inserted into other strings, generally in quotes, to form strings such as 'This feature requires 'While Using' location permissions.'

string.name: wp_permissions_location_Android_always
string.context: The name of the Android location permission that allows access to location at all times. It should exactly match the name of the associated permission in the Settings app on Android, across all languages. This string will be inserted into other strings, generally in quotes, to form strings such as 'The Appointment Arrival feature requires 'All the time' location permissions.'

string.name: wp_test_results_ref_range_two_values
string.context: Text read by the screen reader to indicate the standard reference range for this result component. %1$@ is the low end of the range, %2$@ is the high end of the range, %3$@ is the units of the component. This resource will itself be inserted into another resource, forming an overall string like 'The standard range is 4 to 5 mL.'

string.name: wp_test_results_ref_range_one_value
string.context: Text read by the screen reader to indicate the standard reference range for this result component, when either only a low or only a high is present. %1$@ is the low or high end of the range, %2$@ is the units of the component. This resource will itself be inserted into another resource, forming an overall string like 'The standard range is 4 mL.'

string.name: wp_compose_topiclabel
string.context: Label for a customer service message's topic. Note that mychart differentiates Topic and Subject in messages, where subject is akin to an email subject line, and topic is the general subject matter the inquiry falls within. Topics are always a pre-selected category like Benefits and Eligibility. Subjects are the message heading to the recipient which can be either freetext or predefined category.

string.name: wp_compose_topichint
string.context: Hint for choosing a customer service message topic. Note that mychart differentiates Topic and Subject in messages, where subject is akin to an email subject line, and topic is the general subject matter the inquiry falls within. Topics are always a pre-selected category like Benefits and Eligibility. Subjects are the message heading to the recipient which can be either freetext or predefined category.

string.context: Indicates that a measurement of blood glucose was taken before a meal

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_after_meal
string.context: Indicates that a measurement of blood glucose was taken after a meal

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_glucose_meal_time
string.context: label for a field that lets the user choose a value for whether a blood glucose reading was taken before or after a meal

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_show_daily_trends
string.context: label for a switch that, when switched on, lets the user view a graph of daily data trends instead of raw data values. Param 1: 7, 30, or 365 days

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_insulin_delivery
string.context: Label for data about insulin (medication for diabetes) delivered/administered to a patient

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_basal
string.context: Label for data about insulin delivery where the insulin was administered to meet basic metabolic needs throughout the day i.e. insulin injected slowly by a pump or larger injections of slow-acting insulin

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_bolus
string.context: Label for data about insulin delivery where the insulin was administered to meet episodic requirements i.e. around the time of a meal

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_basal_hourly
string.context: Hourly collected basal insulin data

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_bolus_hourly
string.context: Hourly collected bolus insulin data

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_basal_daily
string.context: Daily collected basal insulin data

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_bolus_daily
string.context: Daily collected bolus insulin data

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_basal_monthly
string.context: Monthly collected basal insulin data

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_bolus_monthly
string.context: Monthly collected bolus insulin data

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_units
string.context: label indicating that a data type is measured in generic units

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_flowsheet_cell_reading
string.context: This string is deprecated and does not need translation

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_flowsheet_cell_reading_metadata
string.context: This string is deprecated and does not need translation

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_flowsheet_cell_reading_new
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screen reader) giving the flowsheet title, the value of the reading and then the value of the date/instant. %1$@ is the flowsheet reading. %2$@ is the value of the cell, %3$@ is the date (long format: En-US November 23, 1937) of the cell and %4$@ is the instant

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_flowsheet_cell_reading_metadata_new
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screen reader) giving the flowsheet title, the value of the reading and then the value of the date/instant. %1$@ is the flowsheet reading. %2$@ is the value of the cell, %3$@ is metadata for the reading (e.g. 'after meal' for a blood glucose reading), %4$@ is the date (long format: En-US November 23, 1937) of the cell and %5$@ is the instant

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_flowsheet_cell_contains_abnormal_data
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screen reader) after reading either wp_trackmyhealth_flowsheet_cell_reading_new or wp_trackmyhealth_flowsheet_cell_reading_metadata_new, informing the user that the reading contains abnormal values (like atypically low blood pressure).

resources.string: يحتوي هذا الصف على قيم غير طبيعية. تحدث مع مقدم رعايتك الصحية عن هذه القيم.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_accessibility_blood_pressure_reading
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screen reader) reading aloud a blood pressure. In en-us, this is SystolicValue over DiastolicValue. %1$@ is the systolic value. %2$@ is the diastolic value.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_basal_insulin_delivery
string.context: Data type for basal insulin delivery meaning insulin administered to meet the user’s basic metabolic needs.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_bolus_insulin_delivery
string.context: Data type for bolus insulin delivery meaning insulin administered to meet the user’s episodic requirements.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_glucose_graph_help_text
string.context: Help text about a graph of blood pressure data. 'Show daily trends' is the wp_trackmyhealth_show_daily_trends string. The backslashes and quotes should stay in the translated string

resources.string: عند تبديل \"عرض الاتجاهات اليومية\" ، يعرض الرسم البياني شريطاً لكل ساعة في اليوم. مع الأخذ في الاعتبار جميع البيانات المحددة في الأسبوع / الشهر / السنة، يمثل كل شريط الحد الأدنى والحد الأقصى للقراءات التي تم أخذها خلال تلك الساعة من اليوم. تظهر نقطة لتمثيل متوسط القيمة (الوسط) خلال تلك الساعة.

string.name: wp_flowsheet_blood_pressure_incomplete
string.context: The alert that appears when one of systolic and diastolic is missing

string.name: wp_flowsheet_unexpected_value_alert_title
string.context: Title for the alert indicating that the readings for the flowsheet values are outside the valid range

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_display_today
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the day button on the segmented date control. Informs the user that selecting this button will show readings for the current day.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_display_week
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the day button on the segmented date control. Informs the user that selecting this button will show readings for the last week.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_display_month
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the day button on the segmented date control. Informs the user that selecting this button will show readings for the last month.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_display_year
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the day button on the segmented date control. Informs the user that selecting this button will show readings for the last year.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_display_range
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the date interval on the segmented date control. Informs the user of the current date range selected. %1$@ is the start date. %2$@ is the end date.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_display_range_today
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the date interval on the segmented date control. Informs the user the current date range selected is today. %1$@ is the current date.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_row_summary
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the summary of a cell on the flowsheeet detail page. The cell displays the data for a flowsheet row, %1$@ is the name of the flowsheet row, %2$@ is the value displayed on the row, %3$@ is the unit for the row

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_row_summary_no_reading
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the summary of a cell on the flowsheet detail page that has no reading. %1$@ is the name of the flowsheet row.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_tap_for_details
string.context: Voiceover hint (read by screenreader) for a flowsheet row that has data. Tapping the row will take the user to a detailed page with all the readings for that row. The string defined here will be prefixed by 'Tap to'

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_add_readings_btn
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the Add readings button that lets you add new readings to a flowsheet. %1$@ is the name of the flowsheet.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_reading_value
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for labeling the value displayed in a cell when adding/editing flowsheet readings, possibility of %3$@ to be empty if reading has no units. $1$s is the name of the row, %2$@ is the value of the reading. %3$@ is the unit for the row.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_no_reading_value
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) when there is no value displayed in a cell when adding/editing flowsheet readings. $1$s is the name of the row.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_systolic_text
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the systolic text entry field in the add readings view.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_diastolic_text
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for the diastolic text entry field in the add readings view.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_bp_readings_label
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) for labeling the blood pressure cell when viewing the blood pressure cell. If no reading, $2$s and %3$@ use wp_trackmyhealth_acc_no_reading_value. %1$@ is the row title of the cell. %2$@ is the value of the systolic reading. %3$@ is the value of the diastolic reading.

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_healthapp_sync
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) signifying that the image is just a graphic and shows the link between the device and the user's MyChart. %1$@ is the app name, i.e. MyChart.

resources.string: %1$@ يمكنه تلقي البيانات من Google Fit

string.name: wp_trackmyhealth_acc_healthapp_is_syncing
string.context: Voiceover text (read by screenreader) telling the user that they are currently syncing data from the Health app with MyChart. %1$@ is the app name, i.e. MyChart.

resources.string: %1$@ يستقبل البيانات الآن من Google Fit

string.name: wp_document_hub_title
string.context: Title used for Document Hub activity, where the user is presented with options related to documents on their record.

string.name: wp_termsconditions_accept
string.context: Accepts the customer's terms and conditions page, taking the user to the front page of the app.

string.name: wp_termsconditions_decline
string.context: Declines the customer's terms and conditions page and closes the app.

string.name: wp_account_settings_choose_default_person_setting_title_patient
string.context: Title for the setting that allows the user to set the default patient they will start viewing immediately after login. Used when a default is NOT set and the user is a patient themselves.

string.name: wp_account_settings_change_default_person_setting_title_patient
string.context: Title for the setting that allows the user to change/remove the default patient they will start viewing immediately after login. Used when a default is set and the user is a patient themselves.

string.name: wp_account_settings_choose_default_person_setting_title_account
string.context: Title for the setting that allows the user to set the default account they will start viewing immediately after login. Used when a default is NOT set and the user is NOT a patient themselves.

string.name: wp_account_settings_change_default_person_setting_title_account
string.context: Title for the setting that allows the user to change/remove the default account they will start viewing immediately after login. Used when a default is set and the user is NOT a patient themselves.

string.name: wp_account_settings_current_default_person_setting_text
string.context: Text that indicates the current default person set for the user. %1$@ is the name for the person currently set as the default

string.name: wp_account_settings_default_person_setting_description
string.context: Description for the setting that allows the user to set/change/remove the default person they will start viewing immediately after login.

resources.string: اختر من تريد رؤيته أولاً عند تسجيل الدخول. بدون افتراضي، سيُطلب منك اختيار شخص ما في كل مرة تقوم فيها بتسجيل الدخول.

string.name: wp_account_settings_default_person_alert_title
string.context: Title for the alert that prompts the user to choose/change/remove the default person they will start viewing immediately after login.

resources.string: من تريد أن ترى أولاً عند تسجيل الدخول؟

string.name: wp_account_settings_default_person_remove_button
string.context: Title for a button to remove the user's default person selection. Without a default, the user will be asked which person they want to view every time they log in.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_setting_title
string.context: Title for the setting that enables or disables the Appointment Arrival feature.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_setting_description
string.context: Description for the setting that enabled or disables the Appointment Arrival feature.

resources.string: استخدم موقع هاتفك ليتم إبلاغ موظفي مكتب الاستقبال عند وصولك.

string.name: wp_appointment_arrival_setting_description_bluetooth
string.context: Description for the setting that enabled or disables the Appointment Arrival feature. Specific to organizations that also use Bluetooth beacons.

resources.string: استخدم موقع هاتفك، مع Bluetooth، ليتم إبلاغ موظفي مكتب الاستقبال عند وصولك.

string.name: wp_account_settings_empty_field_accessibility_text
string.context: Accessibility text for the email and phone field when they are empty

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_row_text
string.context: Title for the setting that links or unlinks the Apple Watch.

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_footer_text_default
string.context: Default description for the setting that links or unlinks the Apple Watch.

resources.string: اطلع على معلوماتك الصحية مباشرة على تطبيق ساعة أبل.

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_footer_text_need_ios14
string.context: Description for the setting that links or unlinks the Apple Watch - informs the user that this feature requires iOS 14 for use.

resources.string: يرجى تثبيت iOS 14 و WatchOS 7 لاستخدام هذه الميزة.

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_footer_text_org_lacks_feature
string.context: Description for the setting that links or unlinks the Apple Watch - informs the user that the organization does not support this feature (likely because their Epic version is too low), but that it will be available soon (when the customer upgrades to May20 or later). %1$@ is the organization's name (eg UW Health)

resources.string: نحن نجري تحسينات على هذا التطبيق والتي ستأتي على %1$@ قريبًا!

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_footer_text_change_org
string.context: Description for the setting that links or unlinks the Apple Watch when the watch is linked to a different organization.

resources.string: قم بتغيير المعلومات المعروضة على ساعة أبل من %1$@ إلى %2$@.

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_footer_text_change_user
string.context: Description for the setting that links or unlinks the Apple Watch when the watch is linked to this organization, but to a different user/mychart account.

resources.string: سجّل خروج المستخدم الحالي من هذه الساعة واربط حسابك الخاص.

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_overwrite_linked_org_alert_title
string.context: Title of the alert shown when a patient attempts to link their Apple Watch when it is already linked to another organization.

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_overwrite_linked_org_alert_message
string.context: Message of the alert shown when a patient attempts to link their Apple Watch when it is already linked to another organization. %1$@ is the name of the linked org, %2$@ is the name of the current org.

resources.string: ساعة أبل مرتبطة حالياً مع %1$@. هل ترغب في الارتباط مع %2$@ بدلاً من ذلك؟

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_overwrite_linked_user_alert_title
string.context: Title of the alert shown when a patient attempts to link their Apple Watch when it is already linked to another mychart user.

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_overwrite_linked_user_alert_message
string.context: Message of the alert shown when a patient attempts to link their Apple Watch when it is already linked to another mychart user.

resources.string: قام مستخدم آخر بتسجيل الدخول حالياً عبر ساعة أبل. هل ترغب في تسجيل دخول نفسك بدلاً من ذلك؟

string.name: wp_account_settings_apple_watch_overwrite_linked_org_alert_button
string.context: Title for a button that links to the Apple Watch by overwriting a previously linked organization.

string.name: wp_connecting_to_website
string.context: message below loading indicator indicating that the app is talking to / connecting to the web server before loading content

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_title
string.context: This the title that appears on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with instructions and feedback about the status of linking their apple watch to the current organization.

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_instructions
string.context: This string appears on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with instructions and feedback about the status of linking their apple watch to the current organization. These are the general instructions to the user that remain constant throughout the linking process. %1$@ is the branded MyChart name.

resources.string: للبدء ، افتح %1$@ على ساعة أبل وأبقها بالقرب من هذا الجهاز.​

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_instructions_line_2
string.context: See wp_linkapplewatch_instructions. This appears as a paragraph line under that resource

resources.string: تذكر إبقاء هذه الشاشة مفتوحة على هذا الجهاز حتى تكتمل عملية الربط.​

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_watch_os_disclaimer
string.context: This string appears on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with a disclaimer informing them of the minimum watchOS version required for the MyChart for Apple Watch app. %1$@ is the branded MyChart name.

resources.string: %1$@ بالنسبة إلى Apple Watch، تتطلب watchOS 7 أو إصداراً أحدث و Apple Watch Series 3 أو أحدث.

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_waiting_for_reachable_watch_app
string.context: This a status message that appears on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with instructions and feedback about the status of linking their apple watch to the current organization. This status indicates that the user must have their watch near their phone and launch the mychart application on the apple watch. %1$@ is the branded MyChart name.

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_install_watch_app
string.context: This a status message that appears on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with instructions and feedback about the status of linking their apple watch to the current organization. This status indicates that the user has not yet installed the MyChart app on their watch, and must do so through Apple's 'Watch' app on the iPhone. %1$@ is the branded MyChart name.

resources.string: يرجى تثبيت تطبيق %1$@ Watch على ساعة أبل قبل المتابعة.

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_is_linking
string.context: This a status message that appears on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with instructions and feedback about the status of linking their apple watch to the current organization. This status indicates that the phone and watch are currently linking, and once linked, it the watch will show the same health feed the user sees on their phone for the currently logged-in organization.

resources.string: يتم ربط ساعة أبل الخاصة بك.

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_successfully_linked
string.context: This a status message that appears on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with instructions and feedback about the status of linking their apple watch to the current organization. This status indicates that the linking process is done. The screen will dismiss itself automatically shortly after showing this message.

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_failed_to_link
string.context: This a status message that appears on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with instructions and feedback about the status of linking their apple watch to the current organization. This status indicates that something went wrong during the linking processes. If the user wishes to link, they must close the screen and try again.

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_unhandled_error
string.context: This a status message that appears on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with instructions and feedback about the status of linking their apple watch to the current organization. If this message appears, it is because the phone has lost bluetooth connectivity (or never had it) with the watch.

resources.string: لا يمكن توصيل ساعة أبل حالياً. لطفاً حاول لاحقاً.​

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_troubleshoot_link
string.context: This string appears on a button which when clicked shows troubleshooting tips. The button is on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with instructions and feedback about the status of linking their apple watch to the current organization

resources.string: هل تواجه مشكلة في الارتباط بساعة أبل؟ انقر هنا للحصول على نصائح استكشاف الأخطاء وإصلاحها.

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_restart_devices_tip
string.context: This string appears on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with troubleshooting tips on how to link their MyChart app to their Apple Watch. %1$@ is the branded MyChart name.

resources.string: إذا كنت لا تستطيع ربط %1$@ بساعة أبل، فحاول إعادة تشغيل كلا الجهازين.

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_restart_iphone_link
string.context: This string appears on a button linking to Apple's support page for restarting an iPhone. The button is on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with troubleshooting tips.

string.name: wp_linkapplewatch_restart_watch_link
string.context: This string appears on a button linking to Apple's support page for restarting an Apple Watch. The button is on a full-screen modal popover activity that provides the user with troubleshooting tips.

string.name: wp_personal_information_title
string.context: Title for the activity that allows the user to verify the contact information.

string.name: wp_contact_verification_popup_mobile
string.context: Text for the popup that allows the user to verify the mobile phone number.

resources.string: نحتاج إلى التحقق من أنه يمكننا الوصول إليك على هاتفك.

string.name: wp_contact_verification_popup_email
string.context: Text for the popup that allows the user to verify the email address.

resources.string: نحتاج إلى التحقق من أنه يمكننا الوصول إليك على عنوان بريدك الإلكتروني.

string.name: wp_contact_verification_popup_both
string.context: Text for the popup that allows the user to verify the email address and mobile phone number.

resources.string: نحتاج إلى التحقق من أنه يمكننا الوصول إليك على عنوان بريدك الإلكتروني ورقم هاتفك.

string.name: wp_contact_verification_verify_button
string.context: Title for the button in the popup that will jump the user to verify their contact information.

string.name: wp_contact_verification_later_button
string.context: Title for the button in the popup that will dismiss the popup.

string.name: wp_pregnancy_hub_title
string.context: Title used for Care Companion pregnancy updates activity

string.name: wp_springboard_goal_accessibility_string
string.context: Accessibility string for a goal card. %1$@ is the title for the goal. %2$@ is the patient's last reading of the goal. %3$@ is the time when the goal was last reported on.

plurals.name: wp_springboard_new_notifications_accessibility_text
plurals.context: Accessibility text that reads out the alert badge which indicates the number of new notifications. Can be used for activities, as well as patient tabs. %1$@ is the number of notifications

string.name: wp_springboard_new_notifications_no_count_accessibility_text
string.context: Accessibility text that reads out the alert badge for an activity that has a bang as an alert, without a number for the alerts

string.name: wp_springboard_patientbar_myrecord_accessibility_text
string.context: Accessibility text for the logged in user's record that is read when their own record is selected in the patient bar

string.name: wp_springboard_patientbar_subject_accessibility_text
string.context: Accessibility text for a subject's record that is read when their record is selected in the patient bar. %1$@ is the name of the subject.
